      20             : /**
      21             :  * TabContext encapsulates information about an iframe that may be a mozbrowser.
      22             :  *
      23             :  * TabParent and TabChild both inherit from TabContext, and you can also have
      24             :  * standalone TabContext objects.
      25             :  *
      26             :  * This class is immutable except by calling one of the protected
      27             :  * SetTabContext*() methods (and those methods can only be called once).  See
      28             :  * also MutableTabContext.
      29             :  */

      49             : 
      50             :   /**

     187             : 
     188             : /**
     189             :  * MaybeInvalidTabContext is a simple class that lets you transform an
     190             :  * IPCTabContext into a TabContext.
     191             :  *
     192             :  * The issue is that an IPCTabContext is not necessarily valid.  So to convert
     193             :  * an IPCTabContext into a TabContext, you construct a MaybeInvalidTabContext,
     194             :  * check whether it's valid, and, if so, read out your TabContext.
     195             :  *
     196             :  * Example usage:
     197             :  *
     198             :  *   void UseTabContext(const TabContext& aTabContext);
     199             :  *
     200             :  *   void CreateTab(const IPCTabContext& aContext) {
     201             :  *     MaybeInvalidTabContext tc(aContext);
     202             :  *     if (!tc.IsValid()) {
     203             :  *       NS_ERROR(nsPrintfCString("Got an invalid IPCTabContext: %s",
     204             :  *                                tc.GetInvalidReason()));
     205             :  *       return;
     206             :  *     }
     207             :  *     UseTabContext(tc.GetTabContext());
     208             :  *   }
     209             :  */
     210           0 : class MaybeInvalidTabContext
     211             : {
     212             : public:
     213             :   /**
     214             :    * This constructor copies the information in aContext and sets IsValid() as
     215             :    * appropriate.
     216             :    */
     217             :   explicit MaybeInvalidTabContext(const IPCTabContext& aContext);
     218             : 
     219             :   /**
     220             :    * Was the IPCTabContext we received in our constructor valid?
     221             :    */
     222             :   bool IsValid();
     223             : 
     224             :   /**
     225             :    * If IsValid(), this function returns null.  Otherwise, it returns a
     226             :    * human-readable string indicating why the IPCTabContext passed to our
     227             :    * constructor was not valid.
     228             :    */
     229             :   const char* GetInvalidReason();
     230             : 
     231             :   /**
     232             :    * If IsValid(), this function returns a reference to a TabContext
     233             :    * corresponding to the IPCTabContext passed to our constructor.  If
     234             :    * !IsValid(), this function crashes.
     235             :    */
     236             :   const TabContext& GetTabContext();
     237             : 
     238             : private:
     239             :   MaybeInvalidTabContext(const MaybeInvalidTabContext&) = delete;
     240             :   MaybeInvalidTabContext& operator=(const MaybeInvalidTabContext&) = delete;
     241             : 
     242             :   const char* mInvalidReason;
